info.title: OpenAPI Specification
info.description: This is a sample server Petstore server.

parameters.name: page[number]
parameters.description:
The number of the desired page

If used, additional information is returned in the response headers:
`Pagination-Current-Page`: the current page number
`Pagination-Per`: the number of records per page
`Pagination-Total-Pages`: the total number of pages
`Pagination-Total-Count`: the total number of records

parameters.name: page[size]
parameters.description:
The number of elements in a page

If used, additional information is returned in the response headers:
`Pagination-Current-Page`: the current page number
`Pagination-Per`: the number of records per page
`Pagination-Total-Pages`: the total number of pages
`Pagination-Total-Count`: the total number of records

parameters.name: email
parameters.description:
Email of the requested account
Eg, `natacha@mitchellerdman.com`

parameters.name: first_name
parameters.description:
First name of the requested account
Eg, `Alicia`

parameters.name: last_name
parameters.description:
Last name of the requested account
Eg, `Francois`

parameters.name: comment
parameters.description:
(Optional) Free comment to give additional information
Eg, `Voilà! In view, a humble vaudevillian veteran, cast vicariously as both victim and villain by the vicissitudes of Fate. This visage, no mere veneer of vanity, is a vestige of the vox populi, now vacant, vanished. However, this valorous visitation of a by-gone vexation, stands vivified and has vowed to vanquish these venal and virulent vermin vanguarding vice and vouchsafing the violently vicious and voracious violation of volition. The only verdict is vengeance; a vendetta, held as a votive, not in vain, for the value and veracity of such shall one day vindicate the vigilant and the virtuous. Verily, this vichyssoise of verbiage veers most verbose, so let me simply add that it's my very good honor to meet you and you may call me V.`

application/json.comment: Voilà! In view, a humble vaudevillian veteran, cast vicariously as both victim and villain by the vicissitudes of Fate. This visage, no mere veneer of vanity, is a vestige of the vox populi, now vacant, vanished. However, this valorous visitation of a by-gone vexation, stands vivified and has vowed to vanquish these venal and virulent vermin vanguarding vice and vouchsafing the violently vicious and voracious violation of volition. The only verdict is vengeance; a vendetta, held as a votive, not in vain, for the value and veracity of such shall one day vindicate the vigilant and the virtuous. Verily, this vichyssoise of verbiage veers most verbose, so let me simply add that it's my very good honor to meet you and you may call me V.

200.description: Get all benches in the given greenhouse

parameters.name: name
parameters.description:
(Optional) Name of the bench
Eg, `my rectangular bench`

parameters.name: shape
parameters.description:
Shape of the bench

If `other` given, `area` param should be passed
Eg, `rectangle`

parameters.name: area
parameters.description:
(Optional) Area of the bench (in square centimeters)

If used, following `dimensions` parameter will be ignored

parameters.name: dimensions
parameters.description:
(Optional) Dimensions of the bench (in centimeters)
Eg, `[100, 200]`

201.description: Create a bench with its area in the given greenhouse

parameters.name: name
parameters.description:
Name of the bench
Eg, `my square bench`

parameters.name: shape
parameters.description:
Shape of the bench

If `other` given, `area` param should be passed
Eg, `square`

parameters.name: area
parameters.description:
(Optional) Area of the bench (in square centimeters)

If used, following `dimensions` parameter will be ignored

parameters.name: dimensions
parameters.description:
(Optional) Dimensions of the bench (in centimeters)
Eg, `[800]`

200.description: Update a bench with its area

200.description: Get all plants with their stages

parameters.name: name
parameters.description:
Name of the plant
Eg, `Onion`

parameters.name: plant_stages_attributes
parameters.description:
Plant stages attributes
A plant stage should have a name, a duration and a position
Eg, `[{:name=>"sprout", :duration=>25, :position=>1}, {:name=>"seedling", :duration=>12, :position=>2}]`

200.description: Get a plant with its stages

parameters.name: name
parameters.description:
Name of the plant
Eg, `Updated name`

parameters.name: plant_stages_attributes
parameters.description:
Plant stages attributes
A plant stage should have a name, a duration and a position
To update attributes of an existing stage, its `id` should be passed
To update the `position` of a specific stage, you can simply pass it alone; other positions will be automatically scaled
To destroy an existing stage, `_destroy` param should be set to true
Eg, `[{:id=>1, :_destroy=>true}, {:id=>2, :_destroy=>true}, {:id=>3, :name=>"stage 3", :duration=>10}, {:id=>6, :position=>1}]`

parameters.name: page[number]
parameters.description:
The number of the desired page

If used, additional information is returned in the response headers:
`Pagination-Current-Page`: the current page number
`Pagination-Per`: the number of records per page
`Pagination-Total-Pages`: the total number of pages
`Pagination-Total-Count`: the total number of records

parameters.name: page[size]
parameters.description:
The number of elements in a page

If used, additional information is returned in the response headers:
`Pagination-Current-Page`: the current page number
`Pagination-Per`: the number of records per page
`Pagination-Total-Pages`: the total number of pages
`Pagination-Total-Count`: the total number of records

200.description: Get all distributions of the given request

parameters.name: bench_id
parameters.description:
ID of the bench where the specimens are placed
Eg, `1`

parameters.name: plant_stage_id
parameters.description:
ID of the plant_stage of the experiment
Eg, `1`

parameters.name: pot_id
parameters.description:
(Optional) ID of the pot used for the experiment
If used, following param `pot_quantity` is required
Eg, `1`

parameters.name: pot_quantity
parameters.description:
(Optional) Number of pots used for the experiment
If used, previous param `pot_id` is required
Eg, `30`

parameters.name: area
parameters.description:
(Optional) Total area of the experiment
If used, previous params `pot_id` and `pot_quantity` will be ignored

201.description: Create a distribution for the given request

parameters.name: bench_id
parameters.description:
ID of the bench where the specimens are placed
Eg, `6`

parameters.name: plant_stage_id
parameters.description:
ID of the plant_stage of the experiment
Eg, `2`

parameters.name: pot_id
parameters.description:
(Optional) ID of the pot used for the experiment
If used, following param `pot_quantity` is required
Eg, `2`

parameters.name: pot_quantity
parameters.description:
(Optional) Number of pots used for the experiment
If used, previous param `pot_id` is required
Eg, `20`

parameters.name: area
parameters.description:
(Optional) Total area of the experiment
If used, previous params `pot_id` and `pot_quantity` will be ignored

parameters.name: page[number]
parameters.description:
The number of the desired page

If used, additional information is returned in the response headers:
`Pagination-Current-Page`: the current page number
`Pagination-Per`: the number of records per page
`Pagination-Total-Pages`: the total number of pages
`Pagination-Total-Count`: the total number of records

parameters.name: page[size]
parameters.description:
The number of elements in a page

If used, additional information is returned in the response headers:
`Pagination-Current-Page`: the current page number
`Pagination-Per`: the number of records per page
`Pagination-Total-Pages`: the total number of pages
`Pagination-Total-Count`: the total number of records

parameters.name: filter[status]
parameters.description: Filter requests by status using case insensitive exact matching

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort requests in ascending order by default, unless it is prefixed with a minus

parameters.name: plant_stage_id
parameters.description:
ID of the requested plant_stage
Eg, `18`

parameters.name: name
parameters.description:
Name of the request
Eg, `My request`

parameters.description: Name of the requested plant (ignored if plant_stage_id given)

parameters.name: due_date
parameters.description:
Due date of the request
Eg, `2020-09-06`

parameters.name: quantity
parameters.description:
Quantity of plants desired
Eg, `150`

parameters.name: comment
parameters.description:
(Optional) Free comment to give additional information
Eg, `The specimens have to be in perfect condition, please be careful!`

parameters.name: temperature
parameters.description:
(Optional) Temperature of cultivation desired
Eg, `35`

parameters.name: photoperiod
parameters.description:
(Optional) Photoperiod of cultivation desired (in hour/day)
Eg, `12`

parameters.description: ID of the requested plant_stage

parameters.name: temperature

parameters.description: (Optional) Photoperiod of cultivation desired (in hour/day)

200.description:
Cancel a request
If the request is already accepted and the current user is a requester, the request will be set as `in_cancelation`
